text: Yolande Gagnon is a former provincial level politician from Alberta, Canada. She served as a member of the Legislative Assembly of Alberta from 1989 to 1993. ==Political career== Gagnon ran for a seat in the Alberta Legislature in the 1989 Alberta general election. She won the electoral district of Calgary- McKnight by a slim margin in a hotly contested three-way race over Progressive Conservative candidate Mark Petros. Her electoral district was abolished due to redistribution. Gagnon ran for a second term in office in the new electoral district of Calgary Nose Creek for the 1993 Alberta general election. She was defeated by Progressive Conservative candidate Gary Mar in a closely contested race. == References == ==External links== *Legislative Assembly of Alberta Members Listing Category:Alberta Liberal Party MLAs Category:Women MLAs in Alberta Category:Living people Category:Franco-Albertan people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Yolande Gagnon
